title: Hot Stocks: 4 stocks that may give returns between 20-78%
description: Analysts recommend PNB Housing Finance, Hyundai Motor, LIC, and Coal India stocks for their significant growth potential. PNB Housing potentially offers a 78% increase due to strong fundamentals, while Hyundai and LIC present considerable returns. Coal India is seen as top pick within metals and mining, driven by power demand and attractive valuations.

html:
A look at some of the latest stock recommendations by analysts. These stocks are expected to return between 20% and 78% as per analyst price targets.

Tired of too many ads? Remove Ads

PNB Housing Fin.
BROKERAGE: MORGAN STANLEY Price Target: Rs 1,520 CMP: Rs 855 | Upside: 78%

  • Share price will rise relative to the country’s index over the next 60 days.
  • Significant margin of safety and outsized upside potential in the stock owing to starting point of fundamentals and valuation
  • Likely accelerating loan growth and product mix shift that results in ROA (Return on Assets) expansion and recoveries from past write-offs not priced into current valuations

Hyundai Motor
BROKERAGE: CLSA Price Target: Rs 2,155 CMP:Rs 1,787 | Upside: 20.6%

Tired of too many ads? Remove Ads

  • Initiate coverage with outperform rating as stock trading at attractive valuation multiples versus Maruti Suzuki Hyundai and Maruti should trade at similar valuation multiples, with both having access to technology through their global parents
  • Hyundai smaller than leader Maruti but has superior unit economics and stability in margins

LIC

BROKERAGE: MACQUARIE Price Target: Rs 1,215 CMP: Rs 839 | Upside: 45%

  • Top pick in insurance space as stock valuations cheap and risk-reward is favourable
  • LIC was least affected by upcoming insurance regulations on capping bancassurance share
  • Price target increased by 21% from Rs 1,000 on account of the decline in PSU discount from 30% to 25%

Coal India
BROKERAGE: MOTILAL OSWAL Price Target: Rs 480 CMP: Rs 368 | Upside: 30%

  • Reiterate buy rating as it remains top pick in the metals and mining sector
  • Power demand to increase in tandem with near-term GDP growth
  • Recent stock decline offers attractive valuation, with stock trading below its 10-year historical average
